sections.title: What is Go?
sections.content:
Go (囲碁, Wéiqí in Chinese, Baduk in Korean) is the oldest board game still played today, with 4,000+ years of history.

**The Board**: 19×19 grid (361 intersections)
**The Goal**: Control more territory than your opponent
**The Beauty**: Simple rules, infinite complexity

**Why Go is Special**:
• Only 2 rules, yet deeper than chess!
• No draws - always a winner
• Handicap system allows different skill levels to play
• More possible positions than atoms in the universe (10^360!)

**Cultural Significance**: 
In East Asia, Go is considered one of the 'Four Arts' along with calligraphy, painting, and music. Mastery of Go is seen as a path to enlightenment.

**The AlphaGo Revolution (2016)**:
When AlphaGo beat Lee Sedol, it shocked the world. Go was thought to be decades away from AI mastery due to its complexity.

sections.title: The Two Rules of Go
sections.content:
**Rule 1: The Rule of Liberty**

Stones or groups of stones must have at least one adjacent empty intersection (liberty) to survive.

• Place stones on intersections (not squares!)
• Connected stones of same color = group
• Groups share liberties
• No liberties = captured and removed

**Rule 2: The Ko Rule**

You cannot immediately recapture in a way that repeats the previous board position.

• Prevents infinite loops
• Must make a different move first
• Then can recapture

**That's it! Only 2 rules!**

Everything else (territory, eyes, life and death, seki) emerges from these simple rules.

sections.title: Capturing Stones
sections.content:
**Liberties** (呼吸点, dàměi):

Each stone starts with 2-4 liberties depending on position:
• Corner stone: 2 liberties
• Edge stone: 3 liberties
• Center stone: 4 liberties

**Groups**:
• Stones of same color touching orthogonally = group
• Groups share liberties
• Entire group captured when last liberty filled

**Atari** (アタリ):
When a group has only ONE liberty left.
"Atari!" is called as a warning (like "check" in chess).

**Capture Process**:
1. Opponent fills your last liberty
2. Your stones are removed immediately
3. Removed stones become prisoners
4. Prisoners count as points at game end

**Tactical Note**: Sometimes sacrificing stones is good strategy!

sections.title: Territory & Winning
sections.content:
**What is Territory?**

Empty intersections surrounded by your stones.

**Scoring** (Chinese rules - area counting):
• Count your stones on the board
• Count empty intersections you surround
• Add captured enemy stones
• Higher total wins!

**Komi** (コミ):
White gets 7.5 extra points (compensation for moving second).
The 0.5 prevents draws.

**Eyes & Life**:
• Group with 2 separate eyes = alive (can't be captured!)
• Group with 1 eye = dead (can be captured)
• Group with 0 eyes = already captured

**Seki** (セキ):
Mutual life - neither player can capture without being captured themselves.
Rare but important!

**Game End**:
• Both players pass consecutively
• Count territory
• Declare winner!

sections.title: Basic Strategy
sections.content:
**Opening (Fuseki, 布石)**:

• Corners are most valuable (easiest to secure)
• Then edges
• Then center last
• Opening moves claim large territories
• Early fighting is usually bad

**Middle Game (Chuban, 中盤)**:

• Invasions and reductions
• Fight for influence
• Life and death battles
• Connection and cutting

**Endgame (Yose, ヨセ)**:

• Count precisely
• Play biggest moves first
• 1-point moves matter!
• Don't play inside your own territory

**Proverbs**:
• "Urgent moves before big moves"
• "Play away from strength"
• "Corner, side, center"
• "Don't use thickness to surround territory" (use it to attack!)

sections.title: Go in the Modern Era
sections.content:
**The AlphaGo Revolution (2016-2017)**:

**March 2016**: AlphaGo vs Lee Sedol
• AI wins 4-1
• Shocked the world
• Lee's Move 78 (Game 4) = only human victory
• Proved AI could master intuition

**January 2017**: AlphaGo Master
• Played online anonymously
• Went 60-0 against top pros
• Revealed to be upgraded AlphaGo

**May 2017**: AlphaGo vs Ke Jie
• Beat world #1 player 3-0
• Ke Jie: "AlphaGo is perfect"
• Final public match - AlphaGo retired

**October 2017**: AlphaGo Zero
• Self-taught (no human games!)
• Beat AlphaGo Master 100-0
• Discovered new strategies unknown to humans

**2019+**: KataGo, Leela Zero
• Open-source engines
• Stronger than AlphaGo Zero
• Available to everyone
• Changed professional Go forever

**Impact on Go**:
Pros now study AI games. Opening theory completely revolutionized. Moves that were "bad" for 1000 years are now standard!
